author: Austin Oyibode
title: Ibori’s travails were politically motivated – Oghara youths ▷ NAIJ.COM
text: Share on Facebook - Oghara Youths Association has urged former Governor James Ibori to pursue his political ambition and overtake his perceived enemies - Led by Favour Ededey, the youths say Ibori's travail in London prison was politically motivated by perceived enemies - However, the youths call on Ibori to be focused and carry the youths along since most leaders have disappointed him The Oghara Youth Association has urged former Governor James Ibori to pursue his political ambition vigorously, overtake his perceived political enemies and recover all that he lost while serving jail term in London prison. The National Youth President of the association, Favour Ededey, said now that Ibori is back, he must put on his political cap and pursue his career to the level he wished for himself. Oghara youths urge Ibori to pursue and overtake his enemies Not less than 5000 youths participated in the welcome of Ibori to Oghara, even as the busy East West road passing through Oghara was a beehive of human activity on Saturday. READ ALSO: Ibori did well for Delta more than any former governor in Nigeria – Okowa’s aide Ededey explained that Ibori’s trials in Nigeria and the United Kingdom were politically motivated, noting that now that Ibori is back he should be more focused in pursuing his political career. He said as it is now, some of Ibori’s political enemies are already jittery, occasioned by his release and triumphant entry into the country. The youth leader urged Ibori to be wise at this point in time, especially as there are plans currently ongoing by some political cabals to cage him from the reach of the people, stressing that he should make himself available to all and act wisely in making decisions. PAY ATTENTION: Get the Latest Nigerian News Anywhere 24/7. Spend less on the Internet! He advise Ibori to focus more on the youths, since some of the leaders have failed the people while he was away. Ededey thanked all that came to celebrate with Oghara people, especially those that stood by their national leader during Ibori’s years of incarceration. Related Stories
